brief_summary.textblock:
In children aged 1yr -18 years with refractory epilepsy Modified Atkins diet as add on to
      ongoing AED therapy would not be inferior compared to ketogenic diet **  in terms of seizure
      reduction from baseline seizure frequency at 6 months

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy of Modified Atkins Diet Versus Ketogenic Diet in Children With Refractory Epilepsy Aged 1 Year to 18 Years: A Randomized Controlled Trial
clinical_study.condition: Ketogenic Diet, Modified Atkin's Diet, Refractory Epilepsy

detailed_description.textblock:
Primary objective:

      To compare the efficacy of Modified Atkins diet compared to Ketogenic diet * in children
      aged 1 year to 18 years of age with refractory epilepsy on anti epileptic drugs at 6 months
      of diet intake  in terms of percentage of seizure reduction from base line.

      Secondary objective:

      Proportion of patients who achieve > 50% seizure reduction  from baseline after 6 months  in
      both groups To evaluate the nature of adverse events in both the groups

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Children aged 1-18 years with refractory epilepsy*

          -  Willing to come for regular follow up

          -  No motivational or psychosocial issues in the family which would preclude compliance
             with the diet

        Exclusion Criteria

          -  Surgically remediable cause for refractory epilepsy

          -  Suspected mitochondrial disorder or diagnosed with a disorder in which high fat diet
             is contraindicated

          -  Previously received ketogenic diet or modified Atkins diet

          -  Chronic systemic disease like chronic kidney disease, chronic liver disease, heart
             disease (congenital and acquired) and chronic respiratory illness

facility.name: All India Institute of Medical Sciences

primary_outcome.description: To develop  an optimal dietary therapy for management of refractory epilepsy in children and adolescents
primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of seizure reduction at 6 months ( sz frequency / wk average of 4 wks) from base line

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.
